headline: In Britain,  Some Courts  Will Allow  TV Cameras
abstract: Judges’ sentencing remarks in some serious criminal cases in England and Wales will be televised, a rarity in much of Europe.
lead_paragraph: LONDON — High-profile criminal cases in English and Welsh courts will be partially televised for the first time, the British Ministry of Justice said on Thursday, in a move that was welcomed by broadcasters but that drew caution from lawyers’ organizations.
keywords: Central Criminal Court of England and Wales (Old Bailey)
